Note:
See Wenzel (1978)
XWenzel, Siegfried. Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle English Poems. Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978, 198-9 for the distinction from 6461
_description: Signs of death, the Fasciculus Morum version — 14 lines in couplets

Bod410.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932: 222.

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
When the hed wakyth& þe lippis blakyþAnd the nose
                    sharpith& þe synow sterkythAnd þe brest
                    pattyþAnd the breth wantyþAnd the tethe ratelythAnd the
                    throte rotelythAnd the sole is went outof the body ne tit but a
                    clowtAnd aftyr be it in pytAnd with erth fast y dyteSone be it so
                    stokynþe sowle all clene is fur ȝyte

BodRawC670.First Lines:
When þe hede quakythAnd þe lyppis
                    blakyth…
BodRawC670.Last Lines:
…Sone be it so stekennÞe sowle all clene ys
                    forȝetenn

             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle

CamGon71.First Lines:
Wen þi hed quakyth& þi lyppes
                    blaketh…
CamGon71.Last Lines:
…sone so it be in erthe I lokenþe soule al clene is for
                    ȝeten

BLEge833.First Lines: Qwen broues hildes doune þe lefte eighys mare þan þe ryght ye…
BLEge833.Last Lines: …þis er the takenynges of dethefor sothe witte þu wele he sal noght leue thre dayes
BLEge833.Note: Written as prose with puncti and space of few letters left blank between lines, in blank verse and occasional rhyming couplets. Preceded by ‘Another’ since in a sequence of prose recipes.

BLHar2247.First Lines:
whan þi handes [sic] quakethþi lippes
                    blaketh…
BLHar2247.Last Lines:
…Anon þou thenkkest þyn hert wolde brastfor þy
                    life may not last
BLHar2247.Note:
Written as prose; occurs independently from Fasciculus, in a
                    funeral sermon.

Lincoln44.Transcription:
wen þe hede wa quakeand þe lyppes blakeAnd
                    þe nose scharpAnd þi synnews starke& þe breste
                    panteþ& þe breþe wanteþ& þe
                    theþe rothelþe& þe þrot rotheld& þe
                    soul is wentof þe body no tit bot a cloutAnd after be hyt on a
                    pyt& with erþe fast hyddesom be it stoken yn sonal clen
                    es for ȝoten
